definition: to deal with (an offender)
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)
colloquial reading for 落[luo4] in certain compounds
to fall or drop/(of the sun) to set/(of a tide) to go out/to lower/to decline or sink/to lag or fall behind/to fall onto/to rest with/to get or receive/to write down/whereabouts/settlement
to leave out/to be missing/to leave behind or forget to bring/to lag or fall behind

sentences.english: The judge promised leniency if the offender confessed.
sentences.chinese: 如果罪犯認罪，法官答應從寬發落。

sentences.english: Tomato, mozzarella , Prawns, squid, mussels, scallops and clams.
sentences.chinese: 番茄，把發落水牛芝士，蝦，魷魚，蚌類。

sentences.english: And for the table holy mercy, will inform YanShiFan Yang Xiu lenient.
sentences.chinese: 而爲表聖上仁慈，通知嚴世藩將楊秀從輕發落。

sentences.english: The father went to prison, but the two boys got off with a warning.
sentences.chinese: 父親進了監獄，而兩個男孩則從輕發落。

sentences.english: She'll get away with a fine as it is a first offence.
sentences.chinese: 由於是初犯，她將被從輕發落，只罰款了事。

sentences.english: He is now at the mercy of the referee.
sentences.chinese: 現在他只能聽由裁判發落了。

sentences.english: The king was very lenient towards his error, and decided to give him the lightest punishment.
sentences.chinese: 國王對他的錯誤網開三面，決定從寬發落。

sentences.english: The court let the criminal off with a light sentence because he had made a fairly honest confession.
sentences.chinese: 法院從寬發落了這個罪犯，因爲他坦白得比較徹底。

sentences.english: They were at the mercy of the conquerors.
sentences.chinese: 是生是死，他們全憑征服者發落。

sentences.english: Surrender now and you will be shown mercy.
sentences.chinese: 現在投降吧，爭取從輕發落。

definition: to turn a deaf ear to (idiom); to pretend not to hear
to admonish/instructions/orders
to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
pinyin: si3 wu2 zang4 shen1 zhi1 di4

definition: to use public office to avenge private wrongs
funds and provisions for the troops/(soldier's) pay
(jocularly) public building that has been lying idle (and is thus ideal for housing mosquitos) (Tw)
to obstruct/to impede
lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy
open the net on one side (idiom); let the caged bird fly/to give one's opponent a way out/lenient treatment
equivocal/ambiguous
to call loudly (idiom); to get people's attention/to make one's views known
man behind the mirror/puppet master/string puller
delaying tactics/stalling/measures to stave off an attack/stratagem to win a respite
bandit
lit. to use the eastern wind (idiom)/fig. to use sb's help
to nod one's head and bow (idiom); bowing and scraping/unctuous fawning
